The company is a giant feed miller, despite its well known performance in industry it was facing a lot of lost production hours and low productivity due to low equipment performance. S2D_sop: As a first-generation college student from southern Africa, I have achieved many firsts. For example, I was the first in my family to acquire Bachelor’s and Master’s degrees in any subject, let alone Engineering. I am also the first in my family to work at the management level in the corporate world. While I am grateful for my accomplishment thus far, I am intrigued by the prospect of achieving another first by earning a Ph.D. from the Grado Department of Industrial & Systems Engineering (ISE) at Virginia Tech. More important than being first, I have an overwhelming desire to make meaningful contributions to industry and society. I see enrolling as a Ph.D. student in Industrial & Systems Engineering at Virginia Tech and becoming a research academic as my vehicle toward attaining this goal. Regarding research, I am interested in exploring the intersection of management systems, information technology, and human factors. While working industry as a subordinate and then as a manager, I noticed that optimizing how humans fit into production processes was a research stream with many interesting gaps. For example, I came to appreciate the human element’s central role in production and why it needs to be explicitly and thoughtfully integrated into the management systems framework. However, I found there to be a lack of accessible and implementable quantitative models that explicitly accounted for the human element—especially those addressing workplace safety and comfort in the production setting.
